documents.document: Seldom seen, soon forgotten. Richard Hilles
When the gods wish to punish us, they answer our prayers. Oscar Wilde
Love is delusion that one woman differs from another.
Fair face may hide a foul heart.
The mind is like the stomach. It is not how much you put into it that counts, but how much it digests.
It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop. Сonfucius
Money often costs too much. Emerson
Formal education will make you a living. Self-education will make you a fortune. Jim Rohn
An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile, hoping it will eat him last. Winston Churchill
When the eagles are silent, the parrots begin to jabber. Winston Churchill
Politicians are like diapers. They both need changing regularly and for the same reason.
Practice is the best of all instructors.
Modesty may make a fool seem a man of sense
Everything takes longer than you think. Murphy's law
Free speech carries with it some freedom to listen. Bob Marley
Lack of many is the root of all evil. G. B. Shaw
I know very little about acting. I'm just an incredibly gifted faker. Robert Downey, Jr.
Success doesn't come to you…you go to it. Marva Collins
What is done out of love always takes place beyond good and evil. Friedrich Nietzsche
Whenever you are asked if you can do a job, tell 'em, 'Certainly I can!' Then get busy and find out how to do it. Theodore Roosevelt
Every portrait that is painted with feeling is a portrait of the artist, not of the sitter. Oscar Wilde
In critical moments even the very powerful have need of the weakest. Aesop
Wisdom is knowing how little we know. Oscar Wilde
All we are saying is give peace a chance! John Lennon
Morality is herd instinct in the individual. Friedrich Nietzsche
Only sick music makes money today. Friedrich Nietzsche
The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends. Friedrich Nietzsche
Success is the ability to go from one failure to another with no loss of enthusiasm. Winston Churchill
Thou shouldst eat to live; not live to eat. Socrates
Fear arises sooner than anything else. Leonardo da Vinci
When you gaze long into an abyss the abyss also gazes into you. Friedrich Nietzsche
Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday. Marquis
That man is idle who can do something better. Emerson
May the Force be with you ! Obi-Wan «Ben» Kenobi

As God is my witness, I’ll never be hungry again!
Katie Scarlett O'Hara Hamilton Kennedy Butler
You can face whatever has to be faced if you master your own fears and simply go on. Eleonor Roosevelt
I can resist anything except temptation. Wilde
We can only change the world by changing men. Wells
I would rather be able to appreciate things I cannot have than to have things I am not able to appreciate. Elbert Hubbard
No man needs a vacation so much as the man who has just had one. Elbert Hubbard
When a girl ceases to blush, she has lost the most powerful charm of her beauty. Gregory I
Vows made in storm forgotten in calm. Shakespeare
Half of the American people have never read a newspaper. Half never voted for President. One hopes it is the same half. Gore Vidal
Every English poet should master the rules of grammar before he attempts to bend or break them. Robert Graves
In revenge and in love, woman is more barbarous than man.
Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is absurd.
I do not know the American gentleman, god forgive me for putting two such words together. Charles Dickens
The light has gone out of my life. Theodore Roosevelt
